Description: Spheroidal vase of porphyritic diorite: with a flat base and two tubular handles. The vase has a high shoulder and a broad flat-topped rim, the latter being chipped around the outer edge. The upper surface of the rim slopes slightly towards the mouth. Interior completely hollowed. On the polished exterior of the vessel is the very lightly incised serekh of Qaa, only visible under close examination.
